articles.author: Guardian staff reporter
articles.title: 'I stopped sleeping': the sometimes difficult path off antidepressants - The Guardian
articles.description: One in seven Australians take antidepressants. How well do we support them when they want to come off the medication?
articles.content:
Six weeks after my doctor advised me to stop taking the lowest dose of desvenlafaxine, an antidepressant I had used for seven years, I returned to my GP.
I was having huge mood swings: one minute Id… [+12477 chars]
